There are 5 ship types players can choose from with limited coins to purchase ships with. On a player's turn, they have the option to sail, fire cannons, seize islands, and if playing with faction abilities will have access to 3 more unique abilities. Players can do these actions in any order as long as they don't exceed maximum sail distance (3 tiles unless sailing over tradewinds), don't fire more times than their ship's health points and have the gold to pay for what they want to do.

Players are allowed to sail up to three ships on their turn a distance of 3 tiles unless assisted by a known trade wind that grants a bonus of 2 tiles of movement. Position your ships carefully as the broadside of a ship and stern/bow impact game play and firing options on and off turn.

Players fire at the enemy by counting the tiles to the enemy ship and rolling that amount or more. On the die is a blank side which if rolled, results in an automatic miss. Cannons aren't perfect weapons so sometimes it's best to use faction abilities to finish off an enemy ship. When a player destroys a ship, they will take the mast off the ship they destroyed and use it in a future transaction to seize an island or turn in at the top of their turn for a bounty reward.

In order to seize an island, a players ship must be adjacent to the island in question. The transfer of ownership costs 2 gold plus 1 gold for each enemy ship that occupies that island within the area (two tiles of the island). The player must also turn in a mast belonging to the island's current faction owner. If all costs are met and paid for, the transfer of ownership is immediate and the first to 6 islands is pronounced the Old Salt and the winner of the battle.

The faction abilities add a new level of replayability and strategy to the game as each faction has 3 abilities that are unique to them and their theme. Players can construct their fleet to offset a particular weakness of the faction or to enhance a strength of theirs. New players are encouraged to play their first 3 rounds without factions in order to gauge their comfortability before adding in the additional abilities and layer of depth this game can reach while still being excellent for those unfamiliar with the wargaming genre.

-description from designer

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Zealot's Guide: Book 8
Zealot's Guide: Book the Eighth
Zealot's Guide: Book the Eigth
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The eighth release of the Zealot's Guide series features:

3 detailed faiths (Player's Handbook style with Spell Lists):
• Church of the Silver Mist (CG - honor, oaths & ethics)
• Cult of the Watchers (CN - math, science, invention, reasoning, knowledge)
• The Thunderer's Temple (CN - war, strategy, tactics)
22 pages


User comments:

The misspelling of "Eighth" as "Eigth" appears on both the front cover and the title page.

First book in the Zealot's Guide series to include credits and a copyright statement.

boardgame.name: Root: Marauder Hirelings Pack & Hireling Box
boardgame.description:
Need allies? Here they are, fiery and fierce. Discover unique strategies and make the Woodland wilder by adding hirelings. Best with fewer players, great with more!

This product contains six new hirelings:
- Flame Bearers and Rat Smugglers
- Vault Keepers and Badger Bodyguards
- Popular Band and Street Band

It also comes in a lovely box to store all your Root hirelings!

Hirelings can be added to games at any player count. With fewer players, the hirelings add new pieces to the map, ramping up the tension and giving you more tactical options. With more players, some hireling cards will flip over to reveal new special abilities to gain, letting you explore unique and powerful strategies.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Root
Root: The Marauder Expansion
Root: The Marauder Expansion (Kickstarter Edition)

boardgame.name: Ski-Spaß Spiel-Spaß
boardgame.description: Players roll and move their pawns on the skiing tracks of the gameboard and try to collect as many victory points (so called fun tokens) as possible. Events on the track make you gain or lose victory points. The events refer to the international rules of skiing.

boardgame.name: Ausgetrickst
boardgame.description:
20 tokens in 5 colours are placed on a 5 to 5 grid. Each player draws a card with a pattern task of 5 tokens in one row. In each turn a player moves one token to a free space. If the situation on the board consists with the pattern task card, the player collects this card and draws a new card.
The player to collect the most cards wins the game.

boardgame.name: Angel Investor
boardgame.description:
Create your wealth by investing in startups. Compete and collaborate with your fellow investors to achieve return on investments.

You play on tiles and move around with you pawn. At the end of the game you will count the values of cards each investment got during the game. The play with most points (best deals done) wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Escape from Old Tokyo
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Blending cyberpunk with 80’s anime action, Escape from Old Tokyo pits a ragtag crew against the horrors of Koto Ward Maximum Security Prison. After a news helicopter crashes inside the sprawling complex, war hero turned outlaw Fury Yamada must run a desperate gauntlet, evading the prison’s bloodthirsty gangs to save star reporter, Maki Mori. But there’s a catch: she’s only got twenty-four hours before the whole place is flooded with nerve gas!

The adventure uses the [pgitem=299997 Neonpunk Crysis] setting, as well as the cinematic, rules-lite Everywhen system. Four pre-generated characters are included.

boardgame.name: Ranger Archetype: Giant Slayer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“The creature stood as tall as my building and plucked me from my bedroom window like I was a peach. As it raised me to its disgusting mouth I was sure that I was done for but lucky for me, someone crashed our impromptu dinner party. Like a hero of old, a dashing and most handsome woman suddenly sprung into view, chopping and slicing the creature to bits before taking me in her arms and ensuring my safety. That’s what I call a rescue, and yes, darling, we did end up having a proper dinner afterward.”
- Countess Eless Brinday, as accounted in The Grand Book of Giants

Killing giants is no easy task, but where massive creatures roam the lands and wreak havoc on communities and the people that build them, it becomes a crucial profession. To be a Giant Slayer is to be willing to risk life and limb against a myriad of towering beasts, lumbering monstrosities, and any looming terrors that seek to consume and destroy the bite-sized humanoids of the realms. It takes someone who is equal parts brave, bold, and foolhardy—all traits that sum up the most legendary Giant Slayers.

This supplement includes:

The new ranger archetype, The Giant Slayer.
2 new weapons for your Giant Slayers to wield.
The new Hooked Chain fighting style.

boardgame.name: A Dozen Vexing Rumors
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

We’re back, gang, with another twelve rumors that are ready to join your GM’s toolkit and wait there patiently until the day that you need them. As you well know, the players are always looking to you when it comes time to adventure, and there can never be enough encounter and adventure ideas in your pocket.

As with the other entries in the A Dozen . . . series of PDFs, A Dozen Vexing Rumors is a systemless work for use with almost any fantasy roleplaying game.

While I am certain that experienced gamemasters will have no trouble adapting the ideas within this PDF to their chosen games, I can also recognize that new GMs – those without years of experience – may feel a little overwhelmed and nervous when the players are expecting to be entertained. If you are one of those new, inexperienced gamemasters, I offer this bit of advice:

You are going to make mistakes. Don’t sweat it, and don’t stress over the game rules. So long as you and the players have fun, you are a successful GM.

boardgame.name: A Dozen Rumors of Other Places
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Not all rumors that the player characters may overhear on the busy streets – or in the taverns of the campaign world – are local. At times, the party may hear rumors of distant lands, other places where the promise of riches and ad- venture exceed the opportunities in their current loca- tion. At such times, the heroes may decide that their best course of action comes down to one thing: visit that other place and investigate the rumors.

A Dozen Rumors of Other Places provides the gamemaster with another twelve rumors that may be dropped into an existing campaign. Whether or not the player characters act on the rumors will determine what happens next in your campaign, so it is ad- vised that, before introducing any of these rumors to your game, you make rough notes on “what happens next?” if the PCs take the bait. Do you allow them to reach the other place, or do distractions change their direction?

boardgame.name: Cabalist
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Join the Cabal!

Legendary Cabalists' is a brand-new class for Pathfinder Second Edition, an occult spellcaster devoted to the secret mysteries of hidden spirits within the world and in worlds beyond! These occult spellcasters tap into the hidden world of magic through their familiars, either following the teachings of a cabal like the Beastcallers, Leyline Cult, or The Seekers of Perfect Form or attempting to remain unbound to master their powers alone. Each cabalist binds with an animus like pyre, storms, portents, or wisdom, and this mystical communion shapes their eldritch power, sometimes even changing their casting tradition, with animus blessings and bonus spells, familiar adaptations, and taboos! You’ll find over 150 options here to expand your cabalist capabilities, including nearly 50 class feats like Bizarre Weaponry, Chant, Secret Lesson, Animus Wellspring, and Toil and Trouble, general feats like Familiar Inspiration and Mystic Animal Tattoo, and spells like ice tomb, silverlight, and blood mantis clutch! You’ll also find complete rules for nearly 20 familiars, from common toads and spiders to oozes, imps, tomes of teeth, and broomstick mimics! You’ll also find sample builds and a fully developed sample cabalist and familiar to show off what the class can do, with a detailed history and personality to drop into your campaign as a mentor, rival, or adversary!

boardgame.name: Bystre Główki
boardgame.description:
A memory game for big and small! Smart Heads is a card game that trains memory and concentration. The player's task is to remember the pictures of the played cards and tell about them in the correct order.

There are also few special cards that change the direction of the card, give player bonus card or challenge players to tell about the last three cards in the reverse order.

boardgame.name: Grave of the Gorgons: Crypt Stone River
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"I never knew that such evil existed beyond the valley!"

Whether by the punishing whims of nature, or through the machinations of villainous entities, there are many forgotten moments throughout history where the world has come oh-so-close to utter collapse. Through the ages, wave after wave of these potential atrocities have been thwarted, put down either at their earliest beginnings or just before the finality of their master stroke. The ruins of these confrontations are embedded in the sands of time, stacking upon each other, layer by layer, leaving behind the relics and remnants of stories not fully apparent in the moment they are rediscovered.

The era of the Gorgons, a tale that may not be known by even the most learned of mages, will soon be encounters along the southern coast of the Great Sea...

Three merfolk sisters, powerful and vile, are having their ancient legacy reconstituted in a manner even they would not have anticipated. With their darkness slowly revealing itself, a group of adventurers are about to clash with the first of the Gorgon sisters on the Crypt Stone River.

Crypt Stone River is a fantasy roleplaying adventure designed for four 2nd level characters, but can be easily modified to present a challenge to larger groups or more powerful characters.

Designed as a single session scenario, this adventure hints at a greater mythology that could easily be expanded and adapted to suit any camapign world.

boardgame.name: NeMoren's Vault 20th Anniversary Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"I have kept a dark secret during my lifetime -
A secret I will take to my grave!"

Baron Paytro NeMoren had left his dark past sealed for decades in the family's underground vault. Now, three years after his death, a group of inheritors have gathered according to his final wishes. At long last, the seal will be broken and the secrets of the vault revealed.

NeMoren's Vault is a fantasy roleplaying adventure designed for four or five starting characters, but can be easily modified to present a challenge to larger groups or more powerful characters.

Designed as an ideal launching point for a new campaign, this adventure takes place in the West Wood Barony, a region on the borderlands between the mostly-human kingdom of Kalendia and the elven forest nation of Arboria. While the area plays an important role in the history of this adventure and the larger world of Karathis, this region is generic enough to be dropped into virtually any campaign setting. You can easily modify town and character names and alter historical facts to suit your own camapign world.

This adventure was originally released in 2000 at the very start of the D20 boom, one of the first third-party supplements for 3rd Edition. This new 20th Anniversary Edition has been updated for the 5th Edition of the world's most popular fantasy roleplaying game, and includes updated and enhanced art and expands the adventure with the Quest for Amelia material.

Can all sins be forgiven?
Can even death stop the thirst for revenge?
Find out - when you enter
NeMoren's Vault

boardgame.name: Lost Tomb of the Bitchin' Chimera: Dead Milkmen RPG Adventure - Dungeon Crawl Classics Conversion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

DCC conversion of Lost Tomb of the Bitchin' Chimera.


User note: This document only provides DCC conversion material, it cannot be run solely as an adventure with the information provided.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Skull Fiesta
boardgame.description:
Skull Fiesta is a light and fun trick-taking game based on Cucumber (Agurk, Gurka).
The most important object is to not win the last trick, and if you can save the most interesting card (Skull or Revolver) to the last trick, then it will be a great surprise for your opponent...or for you!

The combinations of cards changes the end of the game and makes more and more fun and laugh!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Hollywood Racers
boardgame.description:
20XX.

In the wake of a global pandemic, government around the world have decided to forbid all form of art and entertainment, deemed harmful and dangerous to the people.
With movies now banned, Hollywood is no more than a no-man's land.

But unbeknownst to many, there's a bunch of wacky drivers, clandestinely gathering in a huge movie studio, where they engage in completely crazy races, going through movie set after movie set, in search of glory, useful items... and Effixium (especially Effixium).

Which of these "Hollywood Racers" will win the ultimate race ?

Gameplay:
On your turn you may choose to perform up to 3 actions among: Move, Use one of your vehicle's abilities, ram, honk or repair.

Each track (movie set) has different rules and you will have to adapt and use them to your advantage in order to outsmart your opponents.

The first player who manages to reach the finish line with his two vehicles wins the race.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Hollywood Racers: Racers of the Lost Arena

boardgame.name: Crimson Company: Collector's Box
boardgame.description:
In Crimson Company, two opposing players take on the roles of adventurous noblemen in a cut-throat fantasy world. In a battle of wits, they assemble armies of sellswords, from hardened warriors and shady merchants to mythical creatures as old as time.

Your goal in a match of Crimson Company is to conquer two of the three castles in the center. You conquer a castle by amassing more strength than your opponent in the castle's lane by the time that lane is scored. A lane is scored once a player owns at least four cards in it.

Cards represent a large variety of characters, all of which have specific strength values and unique effects. The latter are either one-time instant effects that happen when a card is played, or they are triggered in specific phases of the game. Four randomly drawn cards from the character deck are "on offer". You may bid coins on only one of those at a time. Then your opponent decides to either pay you off, doubling the coins you bid, or pass and let you play the card.

—description from designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Crimson Company: Wildwood Tales

Check out my other products for sale as well! If you buy multiple items, I will combine shipping costs. It’s much cheaper this way.

boardgame.name: Adventure Tactics: Adventures in Alchemy
boardgame.description:
Journey along a new path to the treacherous Tower of Greylock in the Adventure Tactics: Adventures in Alchemy expansion. Leading the way is the new hero, Laine the Alchemist. This expansion also introduces a brand new campaign that leads you through a new path to the gates of the Tower of Greylock. This campaign introduces an entirely new branching Act I as well as a Hard Mode version of Act II with all new potential endings! This campaign will see you through the first five levels of your heroic journey and, when completed, you can continue your adventure by diving directly into Act II of Domianne’s Tower. With the addition of new enemies, new Elite Classes, a new type of Initiative, and non-player controlled Allies, your journey to the Tower will never be the same!

This game requires Adventure Tactics: Domianne’s Tower to play. You can incorporate all the content from Hero Pack 1 as well.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Adventure Tactics: Domianne's Tower

Includes Adventure Tactics: Adventures in Alchemy expansion, Side Quest Guide 2, Adventure Tactics: Hero Pack 1, Adventure Tactics: Enemy Pack 1, Adventure Tactics: Enemy Pack 2, Neoprene Player Mats, and all unlocked stretch goals. Not a stand-alone board game. This is an expansion for Adventure Tactics: Domianne's Tower board game. Order this Board Game Expansion now and Get FREE SHIPPING in the Continental US! Please note: unless otherwise stated paid add ons from the Kickstarter Campaign are not included.

boardgame.name: Altar Ego
boardgame.description:
Through divine dexterity and resource (mis)management, it’s up to you to convince villagers to ignore all those other pesky gods and build you the greatest altar the world has ever seen. Y'know...or else.

During a round, one player will roll the dice. Each player, beginning with the one who rolled, must claim one of those dice and may take an action (not necessarily in that order). During your turn, you’ll vie to make your altar the greatest by building on your altar and recruiting villagers, all while trying to sabotage other players’ efforts to build and recruit.

Once a player’s altar collapses or enough chapters are collected by either a player or the kingdom, the player with the greatest altar wins!

boardgame.name: LUMEN
boardgame.description:
This is LUMEN.

It's an SRD, a design philosophy, a commentary on my games. It's a toolkit.

If you've seen my game LIGHT, you've seen a piece of LUMEN. If you saw FRAME, and NOVA on the horizon, you've seen a few more pieces. Now you have the whole thing.

Make Your Next RPG Illuminated
LUMEN is an RPG system for action packed, power fantasy games. Inspired by some of my favorite video games and genres, I wanted to capture those exciting moments on the screen, and bring them to the table.

It started with my love of Destiny. But I love all sorts of "powerful character" genres. Looter shooters (Borderlands), hero shooters (Overwatch), dungeon crawlers (Diablo). I love to see the numbers GO UP.

With the LUMEN SRD, you can create your own game, Illuminated by LUMEN. Highlights of the system include:


Quick dice rolling
No skill lists. It's about how you approach a task, not what you're doing
Combat is fast, and characters feel powerful
Gameplay loop that keeps the players wanting to get back out there


Atypical SRD
You'll notice that this document is not a technical manual on building games! The tools are there, but they sit between my thoughts and advice on LUMEN games in general. The SRD gives you insights into what I think makes the system special, and how to lean into that.

I hope you feel like I'm there talking with you about LUMEN, instead of instructing you on it.

Huge thank you and shout out to mv for their incredible work putting the LUMEN PDF together. I think they did a terrific job capturing the style of the system, plus it's fully hyperlinked and bookmarked! PLUS there is a ink friendlier version of the PDF for those who want to print at home.

boardgame.name: Grab Your Goat!
boardgame.description:
Grab Your Goat! is a board game for 2 to 4 players and takes an average of 30 to 45 minutes to play – your rascally goats depending! Play as one of four goatherds whose prized goat has escaped atop the nearby mountain. The paths are constantly shifting and the mountain full of pitfalls and perils, preventing you from quickly bringing your beloved goat home. Using your wits, and a bit of luck, you may just be the first to win bra-a-a-aging rights over your fellow shepherds!

To begin, each player should choose their house. Place the 'Top of the Mountain' card in the center of the play area. Create the game deck by shuffling together the directional and effect cards. Building outwards from the 'Top of the Mountain', deal a 7x7 grid from the game deck with the cards dealt face down. Place the houses as the corners of the square grid.

Finally, deal each player 3 cards as their hand. Place all goats on the 'Top of the Mountain'. Place each shepherd on their respective house.

ON EACH TURN:

1) Move your goat

Roll the directional dice. Move your goat in the direction rolled. The 'Top of the Mountain' acts as the game's compass.

2) Your move (choose one of the following)

Option 1: Move your shepherd
Shepherds can only move in the four cardinal directions, following the path formed by face-up cards. If you move onto a face-down card, reveal it and align two arrows to discover the path. If it is an effect card, resolve its effects immediately.

Option 2: Play an advantage card
You may exchange a card in your hand for any face-down card on the board. Play it face-up and keep the face-down card in your hand. If the card played is an effect card, resolve its effects immediately.

Option 3: Rotate your current card
You may rotate your current card by 90 degrees. This can break existing paths and need not form new paths.

MONARCH OF THE MOUNTAIN (Resolving collisions)

If a goat enters an occupied space...
...with another goat, nothing happens. Goats love to hang out together!
...with a shepherd, the goat does not move from its original space. The shepherd is instead moved in the direction rolled (think of it as the goat headbutting the shepherd to the adjacent square).

If a shepherd moves into a space with...
...a goat that is their goat, you win if the occupied card isn't an effect card that will cause you to lose your footing.
...a goat that is not their goat, throw that goat onto an adjacent card of the shepherd's choice.
...another shepherd, throw that shepherd onto an adjacent square of their choosing.


The entering shepherd always throws the occupying player or goat.


The game ends when a shepherd has caught his/ her accompanying goat!

-description from designer

boardgame.name: The Vast in the Dark
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

While The Vast in the Dark can be used as a setting location and an interesting place to explore, the focus of this zine is to provide a framework for Referees to quickly generate massive amounts of area to explore with little to no set up. This is done by giving tools for generating maps and areas in regional, local, and small scale, as well as populating them with various features.

In addition to these tools there is a series of setting specific content to use including: player options to choose, hazards to overcome, societies and factions to interact with, and terrifying mysteries to explore. The Vast in the Dark was made with the intention of being modular and easily adapted into any game.

boardgame.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Companion App Pack #01: Loury Totems
boardgame.description:
This is the first of the three packs with a dark magic in it! You can use this pack when playing any existing scenario.

During your exploration of the Island you have noticed a couple of poles with weird engravings. You decided to research the engravings and found out they actually are the ritual totems made by a tribe, which inhabited this island centuries ago... Following days weird and bad accidents began to occur around them... You have to destroy these malicious constructions!

A physical deck of 75 Adventure and 35 Event cards which will be available also in the companion app.

boardgame.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Companion App Pack #02: Pirate's Map
boardgame.description:
This is the second of the three packs with the pirates in it! You can use this pack when playing any existing scenario.

Skeleton on the shore held an old scroll in its hands. You decided to take it out, exposing yourself to all possible curses... But luckily for you it was just an old map covered with various mysterious symbols. Trying to decipher the code you began to search for the marked spots. It seems that the written symbols represent traps and treasures located here. Although the old Pirate might sometimes mislead you on purpose!

This packs has pirates in it! You can use this pack when playing any existing scenario.

A physical deck of 75 Adventure and 35 Event cards which will be available also in the companion app.

boardgame.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Special Roof Tiles
boardgame.description:
Originally available as part of a Dice Tower Kickstarter, pack C and then as part of an add-on (Treasure Chest Promos) during the Robinson Crusoe Collector's edition Gamefound campaign.

Special roof tiles introduce additional usage of your roof. Enough determination may help you build your roof with an upgrade, so it will provide you functionalities in addition to keeping your belongings dry. The better your roof is the more options you can unlock. Upgraded roof provides additional pawns, which can be used around your shelter, to take advantage of the neighboring territories.

boardgame.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Companion App Pack #03: Rotten Wounds
boardgame.description:
This is the last of the three packs with the zombies in it! You can use this pack when playing any existing scenario.

At the begining you've noticed the smell... Like the Island itself has already gave up to the infection. Trees began to drop already spoilt Fruits... Then the limbs themself started to fall off, one after another. And the worst part was when you injured yourself. Even though you did spill plenty of fresh water across the wound, it began to rot! Not to mention the unimaginable pain, it also lured these rabid mutated beasts towards you! Will you succumb to their fate?

This pack has zombies in it! You can use this pack when playing any existing scenario.

A physical deck of 75 Adventure and 35 Event cards which will be available also in the companion app.

boardgame.name: Template: Heroic Overseer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Gestalt hero is formed from the combination of two beings into one. By combining the might of two individuals, the Gestalt unlocks strange and wonderful powers and abilities. Sometimes these powers are born of the combination procedure itself, the same force that fuses together two minds and bodies into one form unlocking amazing side effects in the process. Other times the Gestalt hero or villain combines the might of two preexisting super-beings into a single form, the combination of aptitudes between them transforming the character’s existing abilities into awesome new outcomes. This PDF contains everything you need to add this new template inspired from DC Comics Firestorm to your Superhero genre game store and local home Super-Powered by M&M games.

boardgame.name: Ouroboros (Issue 3)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the third issue of Ouroboros! This issue features a ton of great content for Tattered Magicks, plus a new alien creature for Aliens & Asteroids!
We have four articles in this issue:

The Art of N(PCs) and Creating Hooks, describing the multi-step process used for creating a NPC in the Faewar of Tattered Magicks
A new pre-generated character, this time for Tattered Magicks with Dr. Livingston Hyde, mad scientist and monster
A bit more about magick in Tattered Magicks, including new details about the Fae and Fae gifts
And a new alien creature who will give the Dread (and your heroes) a run for their money in Aliens & Asteroids

boardgame.name: One Hundred Plus Sailing Events
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A long and adventurous journey at sea awaits the heroes. What exactly will the sailing entail? What secrets does the captain have? What is the talk among the crew like? And what happens once the heroes reach the harbor?
Presented here are 100 unique sailing events that are focused on realism and narrative-building roleplay.
This is an essential tool and reference that a GM will be able to use over and over again.

1d100 adventure hooks and flavorful events for memorable roleplaying situations
Inspired by medieval history and real world events
Supernatural / magic references are kept to a bare minimum – gives you full control of the tone of your game
Almost exclusively non-combat content – keep using your favorite random encounter tables
Includes 12 additional support tables for excellent variation and further inspiration
Perfect for slice of life, OSR, historical and medieval fantasy games
System Agnostic – use with your favorite RPGs

boardgame.name: Odin's Eye: Heavy Scout
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Outfitted with expensive gear, the Heavy Scout is perfectly selected to be the first one out of the ship. In fact, he is a vital, but sometimes overlooked member of the Odin’s Eye. Oftentimes a search and rescue team relies too much on a vessel’s technology and forgets the value of someone with years of experience. Sadly, the Heavy Scout has been doing this so long, he’s forgotten to have a life outside work. With age, comes regret.

In Odin’s Eye, the characters are search and rescue specialists aboard a galaxy-hopping spaceship. They’re dedicated, highly-trained, and often sent into impossibly hostile places. Their motto — “No Star Unturned” — serves as a reminder to never give up, even when the mission could spell their doom.

boardgame.name: Arctic Ancestries, Cultures, & More
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Arctic Ancestries & Cultures, as well as items, monsters, and more!

11 new ancestries & cultures, including the Frost Folk and Snow Constructs (pictured below!)
Four unique, arctic themed magic items
Optional rules and equipment for the freezing arctic tundra
Five frightening, freezing foes, like the eldritch Thing (pictured below!)
Five friendly familiars and animal companions perfect for the frozen north

boardgame.name: Manual of Arms: Armor and Shields
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

GET DRESSED FOR BATTLE!

Manual of Arms is a series of booklets that enhance, change and reinterpret existing equipment and mechanics for non-magical combat. Each booklets deal with a single subject. If there is enough interest, they’ll be collected in a single tome in the future.

What is this book about? This book is a collection of ideas to make armor and shields more diverse, streamlined, balanced, varied, and fun. Many ideas in this book are updated and adapted from other iterations or other games.

Which game system? This book contains ideas that are useful for many games. However, the main focus is the world’s most famous role-playing game, in its latest version.

boardgame.name: Planète Rouge
boardgame.description:
Planète Rouge is a trivia game about the history of the Standard de Liège, the famous Belgian football team.

More than a 1000 questions to challenge local fans of les Rouches.

boardgame.name: Barring the Gate
boardgame.description: Viewed as an easy capture by Napoleon on the morning of Waterloo, the stout defense of Château d'Hougoumont ended up diverting and absorbing an entire French corps of troops! The prolonged action throughout the day completely derailed Napoleon's plans to quickly shatter the Anglo-Allied forces before the Prussians arrived. The gate is barred; can you break through?

boardgame.name: Roll Pirates
boardgame.description:
The roll-write game involves traveling on a pirate ship and having adventures.

On each turn of the game we have a pool of dice, with which we perform various actions in the game: improve the ship, train crew, travel, complete tasks, etc. In the course of the game we mark our journey on the map trying to skillfully plan the journey .

Each turn we use a pool of 6 D6 dice. At the beginning we choose one of 3 available places to start the adventure which we mark on the map. Then you use the dice to reinforce your crew and ship, so created points can be used to travel on land and sea. The moment you get to the adventure you can complete it using dice with specific values. In this way we travel all over the map (collecting rum by the way) and keeping the rule that we can not use the same route twice, so you have to plan your journey in advance. After 7 turns we count points for travels and adventures.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Ninja Panda
boardgame.description:
Roll-write game in which we play the role of a ninja-panda warrior.

During the game we operate with a pool of dice, with which we use on two levels simultaneously: on the character card (which we develop and generate actions) and on the mission card (where we fight and perform tasks)

Each turn we use a pool of 6 D6 dice.Using them we learn new styles of fighting (e.g. with daggers, swords) - where later we can use dice with certain values to create attacks. We can use the dice to learn new skills that will help us, for example, to manipulate the results of the dice or strengthen our attacks. We can also get secret ninja weapons, which are disposable. At the same time there is a mission card game where we use our character to fight other ninjas and complete missions. For example, to defeat the fox ninja we need 2 fire attacks, which are created on the character sheet from the dagger fighting style and certain dice. We can also collect bamboo which activates certain abilities. After 8 turns of the game we count up the points and choose the best ninja panda.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Jurassic Hunt
boardgame.description:
Roll-write game in which we direct a team of hunter cavemen. Using a pool of dice we recruit different types of cavemen and track down dinosaurs. It is based largely on worker-placement mechanics. Requires long-term planning.

Each turn we use a pool of 6 D6 dice. Using them we recruit: trackers, mace makers, archers, spearmen, torches.Each dinosaur in the game can be defeated when attacked by a group consisting of certain cavemen (e.g. 2 mahouts and 1 archer) but after each successful attack we lose one hunter permanently so we have to think carefully about the hunt. Additionally, we can make hunting easier by setting up traps (by using dice with certain values). The game ends after 7 turns after which the points are counted.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Master Your Castle
boardgame.description:
Roll&write game in which our task is to build a castle and set the inhabitants in it. Use the dice pool to build rooms and recruit residents in such a way as to earn as many points as possible.

Each turn we roll a pool of D6 dice. Then we use them as currency to build different segments.

When you own a certain castle segment (e.g. a wizard's tower) you can recruit a certain character (in this case a wizard) to your castle. Individual characters can also be strengthened which will give us more points and invest in building an underground vault.

After 6 turns the game ends and the player with the most points wins, taking into account point bonuses (e.g. having the highest castle, the greatest number of knights etc.)

-description from designer

boardgame.name: President Evil - First Edition
boardgame.description: First edition, published in April 2020.

boardgame.name: President Evil - Second Edition
boardgame.description: First edition, published in March 2021. Includes new character classes.

boardgame.name: Some Kind of Genius?
boardgame.description:
A roll&write game in which we have to boost our brain so that we can extract the highest possible IQ number. Using a pool of dice we determine the parameters and connections between brain cells. A lot of dependencies forcing you to plan long term.

Each turn we roll a pool of D6 dice. Then we use them to reinforce individual cells. They come in 3 colors and are divided into two sets - the left and the right hemisphere of the brain. We use the dice in such a way as to fulfill the conditions of a given cell (e.g. insert numbers in ascending order or giving a specific sum). We have to insert active cells in such a way to get the highest sum of points and activate bonus points (e.g. a certain number of cells in a given color). After 6 rounds the game ends and the player who scored the highest number of IQ points wins.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Dice on Mars
boardgame.description:
Roll&write game in which we have to adapt, explore and colonize Mars. Using the dice pool we perform a number of actions: increase the amount of water and oxygen, raise the temperature, extract resources, build colonies, explore the planet and plan scientific discoveries. Very complex mechanics in very simple rules.

Each turn we roll a pool of D6 dice. We then use them to trigger various actions on the playing field.Each active area in the game requires the use of dice of a certain value (e.g. discovering an invention of dice 5 and 6) and sometimes additional elements. In the game we use 2 types of add-ons: inventions (that we have to discover) and raw materials that we have to extract on the game map (by drawing an appropriate shape). We can also build a base (which we also draw so that it doesn't occupy the same place with the mines) and explore the surface of the planet using the rover. The most expensive (but also bringing the most points) element is to build an observatory. After 8 game turns we count the points and the player with the highest sum.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Time Machine
boardgame.description:
A roll&write game in which we set the time machine in such a way as to visit the highest scoring historical events. With the help of 2 dice we set the machine's clocks in successive turns and thanks to that we move on the time track. Requires very careful planning of subsequent moves.

We use 2 D6 dice each turn. Using their results we decide how to set the 2 hands of the clock, one result directs one of the hands, the other the next. The result is also compared to the other clocks (whether it is greater, lesser or equal) which can give a point bonus. Next, we move a given number of fields on the time map in such a way as to stop exactly on the field with the historical event which gives a lot of extra points. The game lasts 6 turns after which the player who moved back in time the most while visiting the highest scoring events wins.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Moss Creeps, Stone Crumbles
boardgame.description:
A bird perches on a tree branch, singing. A snail crawls across a bed of springy moss. Sunbeams shine through the canopy, their dappled light sparkling on the forest floor.

Moss Creeps, Stone Crumbles is a game about the slow, gentle march of nature. Using drawings and words, you’ll tell the story of a forest grove and how it changes over the course of 100 years. You can play with any number of participants from 2 through 20.

Created for the #CozyGameJam

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Evil Upheaval
boardgame.description:
Evil Upheaval is a competitive cutthroat strategy board game for 2-5 players that insists you work with your fellow villains to complete schemes, then pits you against one another as only one of you can be accepted into the League of Evil. With two different win conditions you need to keep a close eye on your fellow villains. Changing locations, managing your resources, and using your powers to devastating effect is just as important as making sure the League recognizes your accomplishments. So if your evil schemes aren't enough to get their attention, you might have to do something really drastic-like build your own secret weapon and take Captain Mallet out once and for-all.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mossy Mechanics
boardgame.description:
You've seen the power of the Succulent Sorcerers, you've experienced how a Petal Paladin enacts their order, and you have been beholden to the strength of the Bonsai Brawlers - now, be enchanted by the prowess of the Mossy Mechanics!

Mossy Mechanics is the 4th installment to my series of Plant Games where you play as sentient plants trying to fight against bugs trying to kill you while doing your best keep your fellow sentient plants safe.

Take on different mossy forms, and make mossy modifications to yourself!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Succulent Sorcerers!
boardgame.description:
You are sentient succulent sorcerers, awakened by the amazing power that flows through you from the Mother Succulent. But the bugs are hungry, and beyond your home live the Creepy Crawlies from the Unkept. They are coming!

Will you be brave enough to wield the power that lies within you?

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Petal Paladins
boardgame.description:
It is difficult to be a flower. Your kind are plucked, only to be left to wilt. There are some flowers who grow thorns and fight back - but not all flowers can do this. Not all plants can summon the will to become what you are - a Petal Paladin.

Find your oath. Defend the defenseless. Preserve beauty. Be the Light.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Safety Tool Flashcards for TTRPGs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

[T]his collection of TTRPG Safety Tools gives you print-at-home versions of several different tools, allowing you to keep them close at hand and choose the tool the best fits your group's needs.

You're welcome to print and use these cards for your personal table, live stream, or next big event.

User summary:

The Safety Tool Flashcards are distributed as seven PDF documents providing various similar tools in differing formats and visual presentations - each document presents the cards on one page and the instructions on another page. These documents include:


Safety Flashcards
Pause / Retcon / Fade
Stoplight
X-Card
X / Stoplight


An alternate PNG version also is included.

boardgame.name: Swords of Gurrah
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




The game is still in active development, but a version of it has been made available to the public for purchase - Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).




Swords of Gurrah is a virtual reality game focused around hand-to-hand combat weapons. Fighters come from all over of their own free will to risk their lives against man or beast! Fight to the death all to experience the thrill of victory – and if defeated to die for glory! Gurrah is a single player and multiplayer online game. It takes skill beyond typical gaming to keep up: swing, slice, slash, dodge, duck, and destroy. VR does amazing things to bring life-like hand-to-hand combat into your home.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Arena dos Gladiadores
boardgame.description:
Very little is known about this Brazilian game, other than the publisher blurb:

Gladiators fight each other until only one stands alive. The one who survives is the great winner.

boardgame.name: Sairento VR
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A VR cyberpunk-themed game where you play a cyber ninja with multiple weapons to choose from.

boardgame.name: doodle.MON
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

doodle.MON is a simple game that was made[...]because we started talking about how buckwild some monster-friend anime can get.

It's a very simple d6 system that can be played online or in person. All you need is something to write and draw on, a handful of d6, a willingness to be respectful of everyone at the table, and people to play with.

Unlike most games, there isn't a gigantic list of premade monsters for you to capture and raise and there certainly isn't way too much crunch to render the game unenjoyable. Instead, players each draw their monsters within a set period of time, the other players quickly and easily assign stats to it, and the Game Master player runs the game.

As the monsters evolve, or whatever you want to call it, the player is allowed to draw a new monster or add on to the design. This also occurs with a set time limit based on its stage of development. The other players then assign even more points to this new design.

boardgame.name: Atom@tak
boardgame.description:
"The aim of the game is to make as many compounds as you can, and to destroy as many of your opponents' compounds as possible. The winner is the person with the highest score (the sum of all the atomic numbers of the elements making up the surviving compounds) at the end of the game." - Description from the instructions.

Atom@tak is a simple card game in which players create chemical compounds in order to score the most points. On a player's turn, they may play cards from their hand to form chemical compounds based on the real electron configuration of the elements involved. Some compounds are poisonous, explosive, or radioactive which can destroy opponents' compounds if they do not have a card to defend against it.

boardgame.name: Forbidden Engine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In a foreign world where reality once was decided by a sect of pacifists and later modified by the will of malevolent and benevolent terrors, you play as either one such terror trying to impose their will upon the world or a human being pushed along by the forces of fate.

A 3+ player table-top RPG

boardgame.name: An Alien Virus Among Us
boardgame.description:
Description by publisher:

When a space exploration spacecraft was in its way back home, the waste filter detects the presence of an infection.

According to analyzes, the alien virus is dominating one member of the crew, and is ready to infect the others.

While the crew try to find out who is infected and seek a cure, one of the ship's engines is defective, and an anonymous message arrives to all the crew: "We are already doomed, if this ship arrives on Earth, humanity will be contaminated".

Players have a few days to eliminate the alien infection before the ship arrives on Earth, however, not all players have that goal.

Before the end of the trip, the infected player must contaminate at least half of the crew, and the saboteur wants to blow up the ship.

boardgame.name: P.RPG - Persona Tabletop Role Playing Game
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to this Persona-based Tabletop RPG where you're going to experience the video game series from Altus as an analogic Alternative with still very similar mechanics.
...
"At the distance on the top of a building, a mysterious main-cast type character with a black coat and long waving white hair stands looking sadly at the city. The person stares while the river flows through and the sounds of cars echoes."
boardgame.rpg: P.RPG - Persona Tabletop Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Operation Penguin
boardgame.description:
Your mission, if you choose to accept it.
You are all secret agents.
Your task is to steal vital top secret information to protect the world & raise conservation awareness.
You will be armed with the latest spy gadgets, all while wearing a smashing tuxedo.
You’re also a penguin.
Double O Penguin.
This message will self-destruct in 3 seconds...


This is a short RPG written for the Felonious Fauna 2k19 jam. It's about penguins being secret agents, and providing some cool wildlife facts.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Others
boardgame.description:
Others is a one player game for exploring the world of those we see as different than ourselves. The game encourages us to look at people we see as different from us and ask questions about them. This one player experience will not ask us to directly engage with the Others, only to look at them.

Based on research and studies on how we perceive others, and how we value people like ourselves, Others is a series of exercises designed to help us humanize each other. It is a simple, accessible exercise.

CW: Othering

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Star Trek 50th Anniversary Tridimensional Chess Set
Star Trek Tridimensional Chess Set
Tridimensional chess
boardgame.description:
Originally a stage property built by Irving A Feinberg, for the Star Trek television program, the most popular 3D Chess variant, tri dimensional chess was included in the 1975 Ballantine Books publication of Franz Josef Schnaubelt's Star Trek Star Fleet Technical Manual.
Andrew Bartmess, a chess player and Star Trek fan, encouraged by Schnaubelt developed a full set of rules of play.
The military fighter pilot and noted chess player, John Hawkins, wrote a set of rules based on aerial combat tactics and these are now the official rules of the World Tri Dimensional Chess Federation.
A full set of rules covering tournament games was written by Jens Meder.
The game is played using much the same move patterns as standard chess but incorporating vertical movement across three different board levels.
Tri Dimensional Chess also incorporates four board sections which may be moved around and between the three levels.

boardgame.name: pieces
boardgame.description:
You are trapped.
Your pieces are your only resources.
Escape, or fall apart trying.


CONTENT WARNINGS

Embedded: body horror, gore, physical violence, dysphoria, exploitation, being trapped.
Potential: illness/viruses, psychological trauma, abduction, religious violence, medical violence, cults, self-harm, parasites, being hunted.


pieces is a GM-less tabletop game for 3+ players that involves cutting up and taping back together paper dolls. Requires paper, drawing utensils, scissors, tape, a 4-sided die, a deck of 52 cards (jokers removed), and a bag.

Interpret cards to create situations, vote on solutions, and sacrifice pieces of your body to solve problems. Cooperate with the other players to build a story as you destroy your original body and build yourself a new one.

Inspired by body horror media like Society (1989), The Thing (1982), Junji Ito's work, The Magnus Archives podcast, and Upgrade (2018), among others. This game focuses on themes of sacrifice, control over your own body, and what makes you human.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: SideHustle: The Party Game for Entrepreneurs
boardgame.description:
Players are given a random word business name and category and have to come up with and pitch a brand new business idea to other players. Both "Funny" and "Fundable" pitches are rewarded so multiple play styles can succeed.

It's Like Shark Tank meets apples to apples.

How its played:
-Split into 4 teams. 1 team starts as the "Investor", the rest as "Entrepreneurs"
-The investor pulls a SideHustle Card with a random business name that doesn't exist on it (ie. Goose Booster, or FlipStak) and rolls an industry die to pick the category (ie. Food & Beverage, or Health & Wellness).
-The Entreprenuer teams then brainstorm a brand new business or product and take turns each pitching their version of the Side Hustle to the Investor Team.
-The Investor then hands out a Funny card and a Funny card as they like based on the pitches/presentations of the Entrepreneurs.
-The roles then rotate and first team to 5 cards, wins

SideHustle essentially creates parameters for creativity for the players and plays to many different player styles. Silly Ideas and presentational styles may win the Funny card, while analytical and methodical approaches may win the Fundable card.

The materials are family friendly and because the ideas come from the players, it's a different game every time.

-description from publisher

A new promo pack with four new clue cards and four new means cards.

Boba Tea

You are transported into a mysterious arena. You have to collect energies scattered around the arena to strengthen yourself.

The game consisted by six different 'genre' to play with. Every game, you can choose the 3 of them to form the main deck. Then you and your opponent take turns to buy cards from main deck or to attack.

boardgame.name: What's Missing: Purple Version
消失的主角 紫色版
boardgame.description:
What’s Missing? Purple version is a drawing game that contains 240 cards with line drawings, sorted by difficulty (level 1: a belt, level 4: Pegasus for example).

In a round, each player takes a card, places it under a transparent paper - making sure to hide it behind the cardboard screen - and draws on it things that would help other players to guess what's on the card.

After finishing the drawing, the drawer removes the card and shows only the transparent paper to others. The other players have to guess what's missing on the transparent paper, in other words, what was on the drawer's card. The player who first guesses correctly earns 1 point, with the drawer losing 1 point if no one guesses.

To win, being clever is more important than being a good artist. Young drawers can give other players a clue based on what kind of things are on the card.
For those who own the first yellow version of What’s Missing?, you can double the number of cards up to 480, the number of players up to 12 and the fun with this second version!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Sailor & Gamer Pack
boardgame.description:
2 new characters's to use with the basegame along with miniatures from Awaken Realms and triple -layered player boards.

The set contains:
4 Sailor figures (2 male and 2 female)
4 Gamer figures (2 male and 2 female)
1 triple-layered player board for Sailor (2-sided)
1 triple-layered player board for Gamer (2-sided)

Rules for the Gamer: One new survivor to take with you on your adventures in Robinson Crusoe: The Gamer. Like all characters in Robinson Crusoe, there is both a male and female side. This survivor is different from those in the base game. They have no invention, using only their wiles and tricks to help the party succeed.

The available actions are as follows:

Dummy Player: "I'm surprised how easy this is!'" Discard 3(D) to gain Brown/Grey Action pawn this turn.

AC Bonus: "Never count your money while you're sitting at the table." Spend 2(D) to ignore one wound when hunting.

Cheat: "I will do the right thing, once I've exhausted all alternatives." After resolving an Adventure card effect, spend 3(D) to NOT shuffle it into the Event deck, and discard it.

Go Fish: "I suggest a new alternative. Let the island win." Spend 3(D) to draw two Mystery cards. Resolve only the first Treasure from the drawn cards. Discard the rest.

Rules for the Sailor:
The sailor is a great swimmer. He can discard two determination tokens to ignore river tiles when calculating distance on the island.

The sailor has a treasure map. For three determination tokens, he can take a special gathering action once on an island tile with a totem icon. If successful, the Sailor draws a mystery card, resolving only a trap or a treasure. This ability may only be used once per tile, even if the tile has more than one totem icon.

The sailor has some tricks to conserve food. For 2 determination tokens, he can change one food into one non-perishable food.

The sailor is also tough. He can discard 1 determination token to re-roll an injury die (brown, grey or green).

boardgame.name: Reventure: Orbtale
boardgame.description:
The tabletop sequel to Reventure, the game with 100 endings, revolves around the 4 legendary orbs able to grant any wish.

12 Heroes embark on a mission to retrieve them against multiple dangers and foes from the Reventure universe.

The game is played in syncronous turns during chapters consistint in 3 phases:


Exploration phase: Every player draws 2 cards
Organization phase: Every player keeps up to 3 cards in their hand and the res in their inventory, on a pile over the table. Instead of storing them, they can also be discarded.
Combat phase: Each player may attack another one by playing on of the cards in their hand faced down against another player, who does the same. The winner card is determined via a rock-paper-scissors system, and its text is applied afterwise. If a tie happens, the player with less inventory wins. The cards go back to their owner hands after.


If you kill an opponent (by depleting all of its 5 health tokens with your cards), you may steal any 2 cards from its inventory or hand and add it to your inventory.

The goal of the game is to gather all 4 orb cards, either by drawing them on the explore phase, stealing them using special items or dragging them from the other hero's corpses.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: TrollsZine (Issue 11 - 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This 11th issue is dedicated to the original proprietor of Flying Buffalo and publisher of Tunnels and Trolls, Rick Loomis. He sadly passed in August 2019 after bringing games to us in 5 decades. Everyone involved has done their best to make this issue worthy of his work and memory. I am very pleased to introduce new writers and artists in this Trollszine – with Duncan Beach and Peter Panda appearing for the first time, as well as the very welcome return of Ken St Andre, Sid Orpin, Andy Holmes and David Lucardie . Thanks to our brilliant contributors we are breaking new ground, with photos, and a crossword by Cameron Dubeers as well as exciting adventures and fascinating articles. We continue to be very well supported by artists, with many original works featured – debuting Tabitha Donahue & pieces by ME Volmar, Simon Lee Tranter, Sid Orpin, David Ullery & Peter McKenzie. John Prentice returns with another map. We are also honoured by the presence of Ken St Andre, Steve Crompton and Liz Danforth, roleplaying legends all, sharing their memories of Rick Loomis. Trollszine - By gamers, for gamers
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Exotic Items Found in the Best Magic Shops
Molten Magic, Boozers Guide to Fantasy Miniature Painting
Rick Loomis & Flying Buffalo as Rick Told it to me...
When is a GM Screen not a GM Screen?

boardgame.name: Cosmos: Age of Sail - Charted Space
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Well Humanity didn’t make it easy on itself. The twin miracles of the Newton Manoeuvre and Kessler Jump Drives opened the paths to the stars; gravitic technology and genetic and environmental modification followed in their wake. And yet jealousy, greed, rivalry, war and all the old follies of Humankind remain. The stars would not simply fall into Terran hands; the heavens would have to be won.

Expansion and colonisation were fitful. Driven by the desperation of a poisonous over-crowded Earth, by curiosity and naked ambition and hindered in turn by reticence, recession and infighting. The discovery of life beyond Earth thrilled the adventurous almost as much as it made others fearful of what else might be lurking out in the black.

It is 2400. A new era dawns and Humankind has finally carved out a place for itself among the heavens. Now it is time to steel yourself for adventure; to scramble together enough credits for that frozen low berth ride to the new Colonies, to sling your bag over your shoulder and brave the gangplank to board that Frontier scout ship or to jack your Spacer pilot brain into the Kessler Drive interface and crest the swells of another dimension.

Welcome to the stars!

Within these pages you will discover…

49 Completely new mapped and detailed subsectors
A History of Humanspace
A guide to sailing the dynamic alternate jump space reality of the Aether
The Spacers Guild career path for starship crews
The Wayfarer’s Guide to the Galaxy – A glossary for 2400, Genetic augmentation technology and two new starships
Aliens of Humanspace – The loyal Hoont and inquisitive Hriki

boardgame.name: Penumbra Enclave
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

AAW Games Mini-Dungeon for 4–5 characters of levels 8-9

Designed to work with Rise of the Drow, this adventure takes place in the Underworld.

The Academy of Shadow, based in the drow capital of Holoth, is a renowned school of wizardry for drow of all genders.

Its students do not stay confined to its halls, however; on occasion, its students journey under a watchful guardian to an outpost known as the Penumbra Enclave. Here, they learn powerful magic from an unlikely source that forged an alliance with the Academy decades ago: a coven of Upperworlder hags that elected to, as they say, ‘put up with the sniveling brats’ in exchange for learning magic only the drow can teach.

The heroes just may stumble upon this educational field trip and end up gathering information on the school and Holoth, or simply take what rare drow-made magic items they can find.

boardgame.name: Dormant Dungeon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nearby, there is an old dungeon entrance that was sealed hundreds of years ago. This dungeon is on the private property of a noble, who would like it opened. Your mission should you choose to accept it will be to travel to the entrance, and open the door by any means. The following clues have been passed down through the generations to aid in opening this door.
“Twenty-Five Produce The Five.” & “Create Stacks To Break The Wax.”

This adventure is best played with a group of 1-5 characters of level 4-6.

boardgame.name: Tomb of the Twilight Queen
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Devious traps and fabulous treasures abound in this adventure for the world’s greatest roleplaying game!

Centuries ago, the Twilight Queen reigned over the most powerful empire in the world. But her realm now lies in ruins, her people are scattered, and her remains are buried in a grand tomb full of deadly traps and marvelous secrets. A renowned scholar has hired you to enter the tomb in search of a fabled artifact, but you will need all of your courage and ingenuity to survive...

Tomb of the Twilight Queen is a 4- to 8-hour adventure for 1st- through 4th-level characters. It has been thoroughly playtested, requires minimal preparation to run, and can be easily transported to any Fifth Edition campaign world!

boardgame.name: Mimica
boardgame.description:
Players draw a card and try to act out the pictured animal or object with gestures and / or voice. The other players guess what has been depicted until the correct answer is given.
The depiction is judged with victory points.
The winner is the player to collect the most points after a pre-arranged number of rounds.

boardgame.name: Flying Gang
boardgame.description:
In the Flying Gang you take the command about a small ship and try to get a member from the Flying Gang in the 17th century.

In the Flying Gang were some of the most famous Pirates like Benjamin Hornigold, Henry Jennings, Edward Teach alias Blackbeard or Anne Bonny......

It is a 2-4 player turn based game with some historical events.

Like Thirty Years' War, Western Design or Holmes Bonefire.

You can raid citys, attack other ships to get more gold or Trade with the nations in the game.

In the game you can get bigger ships by two different way.
To bye or raid the other ships.

Easy battle system like Scissors-stone-paper.
Get victory points by quest raid other ships or Nations find treasuries from other Pirates. by more Equipment for your ship.

In the game are a lot of different cards.
Sea movement cards, Treasure cards, Equipment cards, Political cards and Quest cards.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Cyberpunk Red: Combat Zone
boardgame.description:
The world of Cyberpunk Red is set in the year 2045, during the reconstruction of Night City. Massive megabuildings light up the skies above the rebounding Corpo Plaza, while cyber-enhanced gangs battle in their shadows, each carving out a bloody piece of ground to call their own. In Cyberpunk Red: Combat Zone, you lead a gang through pitched battles or campaigns. Equip your gang, hire your mercs, and build your street cred to dominate the hellish rubble of the Combat Zone and emerge as the new master of the streets.

Cyberpunk Red: Combat Zone is a tabletop miniatures skirmish game, featuring Monster Fight Club's [RE]ACtion system, where every character has a set of skills, abilities, and actions they can use in the game. Actions come in three colors, which match three types of dice (d6, d8, or d12. Which color action a character takes determines what dice they roll.

Gameplay quickly moves back and forth between players. When a character is wounded, their actions get worse - but they also can have a chance to react to the attack by moving away or counterattacking. The character with control of the battle is the one who is currently taking actions with one of their characters. You lose control when your active character runs out of Actions. Characters can try to activate other friendly characters. This creates fast-paced back and forth gameplay, where control of the game passes back and forth, without getting bogged down in phases, upkeep, and accounting.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dra. Motus y los Cordis
boardgame.description:
"Dra. Motus and the Cordis" is a board game to develop socio-emotional skills for children over 6 years old and adults. It has been created by Víctor Garrido and Pablo Cárcamo, illustrated by Juanca Cortés, and edited by Boreal Ediciones.

Dra. Motus is a leading scientist who has dedicated her life to making robots capables of behaving like human beings. After years of work and effort, she has managed to give life to "the Cordis", fabulous creatures with great knowledge but who are still learning about the emotions of humans. To check the emotional abilities of the Cordis, Dra. Motus has designed a series of questions that must be answered through beautiful illustrations in order to interpret the emotions of the other players.

In each of the game modes, you will assume the role of Dra. Motus and question the other players, who will be Cordis looking to show that they understand emotions better than the rest. In this challenge, each Cordis will be equipped with an emotion chip. As in life, different emotions allow us to act in different ways: emotion chips offer Cordis various abilities during the game. Along with this, the illustrations will be great allies to interpret the emotions of Dra. Motus in different situations.

COMPETITIVE MODE
Each player receives 5 image plaques. One player is Dr Motus, who must pick a situation card. Each situation card has 2 scenarios, and the doctor must choose one of them. Then, every other player must pick one of their image plaques that they believe best represents the feelings of Dr Motus about the situation. Then Dr Motus picks the best one and that player wins a point. Since Dr Motus didn’t had the chance to win points, she has the option to face a challenge card.
Then, another player plays the role of Dr. Motus.
In the competitive mode the first person to reach 4/5 victory points (depending on the number of players) will win.

COOPERATIVE MODE
I this mode we display 3 emotions cards in the center of the table and every player receives 3 image plaques.
Dr Motus must pick one of the image plaques and place it on the table, without saying what emotion that cards mean for her. Then, all other players as a team try to guess the correct emotion. If they guess right, they win a point. In the cooperative mode players try to get the best score possible and compare it to a table.

boardgame.name: Knast Das Gesellschaftsspiel
boardgame.description:
On his turn as a snob, a player rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. There are opportunities to gain or lose money and there is a risk to be thrown in jail, which has a special track. On his turn as a prisoner, a player rolls one die and moves that number of spaces around the jail track with the opportunity to be released earlier than expected (and return as a snob) or to be sentenced to more time (more rounds) in jail. If the players punishment exceeds 25 years (each penalty measure is cumulative), he's out of the game.

The player who collects as a snob the critical amount of money to buy 2 expensive certificates, wins the game

boardgame.name: Animeter
Animètre
Лесная башня
boardgame.description:
The trees are full of tasty apples so it’s time for forest animals to have a feast! But to reach the fruit is not a simple task so animals decided to cooperate. One by one they climb on the tops of each other’s heads to form a tall tower. Hares use their long ears to lift their friends, hedgehogs chase off predators hiding between the leaves and tiny mice can reach apples in the hollows. How to make it to that mellow red apple?

In Animeter, each player can build up to 3 towers using 9 cards with various animals. Reach as many apples as possible and avoid dangerous predators. Use your sight: you cannot check the height of your towers during the round. Collect combinations of animals’ abilities. And, finally, after each player plays the final card, measure the towers ,and find out who gathered most apples and won the game!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Later Alligator
boardgame.description:
Pat the alligator, a (mostly) harmless and (probably) innocent reptile is at the center of a conspiracy that could bring down the biggest, scariest family in Alligator New York City: his own! Explore the city, meet the Family, and try to save Pat before the clock runs out.

Source: [The Steam page for the game].

boardgame.name: Vampire: The Masquerade – Rivals: Blood & Alchemy
boardgame.description:
Trouble is Brewing.

Blood & Alchemy is an expansion for Vampire: The Masquerade - Rivals Expandable Card Game that adds two new clans: Tremere & Thin-bloods. The Tremere are masters of Blood Sorcery who draw incredible power from their Blood, while the Thin-bloods must mix a plethora of chemicals with their Blood to extract power from it. You may play these two clans head-to-head or simply integrate them with your Core Set to give you more options for mixing clans and creating new decks!

Features:

Adds two new clans: Tremere & Thin-bloods.
Play these two clans head-to-head or integrate them with your Core Set.
Includes a 30 card Crypt Pack to customize your decks!
Designed for 2-4 players, ages 14+ to play in 30-70 min per game.


—description from the publisher
