boardgame.name: Plasty: A Thing of Beauty
boardgame.description:
A live-action role playing game set in a plastic surgeon's waiting room.

This game was an entry in the 200 Word RPG Challenge in 2019 and originated in a tweet as part of my #52x280 Game Design challenge.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Mythic Kébec
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Strange rumors travel on cold winds and strong currents in Mythic Kébec. At the British Crown's request, the Society comes to Quebec City to lead investigations in an area populated by French Canadians for two centuries and the First Nations for much longer. This 15-page supplement features two new archetypes, eight creatures inspired by French-Canadian folklore to use as vaesen, eight NPCs, as well as a description of Quebec City and its surroundings. Have your characters take a trip to Mythic Kébec, set a whole campaign here, or import the content to your Mythic North campaign.

boardgame.name: The Night Train: Mini-Encounters for Overnight Travel in Vaesen
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The locomotive is the modern way to travel! With the power of steam harnessed under your reins and our attentive staff at your disposal, you can be sure you'll reach your destination rested and relaxed.

See our timetables and ticket prices in the Central Station, Upsala, for more details."

These mini-encounters are intended for players travelling overnight by train although they can easily be adjusted for other modes of transport, even nights spent at inns or taverns. All players make a Vigilance test at the start of the night and any that succeed become aware of an unexpected occurrence.

boardgame.name: The Draug
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

And as bad as he had been to deal with in life, he was a great deal worse after he was dead, for he walked again a great deal.
— Laxdaela Saga

Draugar are a type of revenant, most common in Iceland but known across the Mythic North. They are presented here for Vaesen with descriptions of powers drawn from the Icelandic sagas, plus case studies of four legendary individuals and a description of a common sub-type: the haugbui or mound-dweller, which inspired Tolkien's barrow-wights.

boardgame.name: The Helhest
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hel rides about on a three-legged horse, destroying men.
— Jacob Grimm

Denmark has its own type of church grim, with its own powers. Formerly associated with Hel, the Norse goddess of the dead, the Helhest is the ghost of a horse sacrificed to protect a new graveyard. Woe to those who encounter one, for they will not live long.

boardgame.name: Raptor Island
boardgame.description:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/hayballgames/raptor-isl...

A 2-5 player action card game where players encounter dinosaurs to acquire their DNA, fuel the escape chopper and escape Raptor Island.

Each player must start the game with a hand size of three cards. During the game you will always draw a card at the start of your turn from the play deck found in the middle of the table. After drawing, players may play one card on their turn to help them get closer to their goals, be it through scrying the top few cards of the deck, or forcing another player to hand over a card to slow their progress.

Finding Dinosaur DNA is your primary goal. They are one of many Item cards you can find in the deck alongside Flare, Tranquilizer Gun or Raptor Egg cards and many more.

As a collective, every player shares the second goal. A set number of Fuel cards must be played to the Fuel Stockpile for any player to win the game. Fuel cards are another Item card you can find in the deck.

Finally once you have the required number of Dinosaur DNA and sufficient Fuel has been played to the Fuel Stockpile, you are ready to play an Escape The Island card and WIN THE GAME.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Satanic Witchcraft
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Satanic Witchcraft is a 5 page supplement for the Vaesen RPG by Free League Publishing. This document draws upon historical accounts of satanic witchcraft from America and Sweden from the 14th century to present day. Contained within are rules for the new Witch-Finder archetype, a new vaesen called Carrier, eight new enchantments, three new curses, four new items of power, and four new magic items all themed around satanic witchcraft.

The Witch-Finder: Part priest, part private investigator, the Witch-Finder excels at rooting out and defeating the mortal servants of Satan. Complete with motivations, traumas, dark secrets, relationships, and three new talents, this new archetype brings a new perspective to the Vaesen game while blending in seamlessly.

New Vaesen: Based off of an obscure confession from a Swedish witch, Carrier is a cat-like creature who attends the satanic Black Mass. Inside this supplement, you'll find complete rules to add Carrier to your game of Vaesen, as well as three examples of concflicts, and of course a ritual to banish it from the earth.

New magical powers: Enchantments and curses lifted from tales and confessions from witch trials; these new elements will help bring a fresh tone to your game as well as terrify your players!

New items of power and magic items: 8 new items for your players to uncover, from the Hand of Glory to the common crucifix, and of course all the rules you need to bring these items to life. However, be careful using them as the consequences can be dire!

boardgame.name: Sáivu
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Soon after we started to get into the mountain, the setbacks began to come one after the other. Tunnels that were started suddenly collapsed for no apparent reason. Several miners fell ill. Equipment broke down. To date, we have made very little progress. I know it is much to ask of you to come to me here in the wilderness. But if we do not resolve this situation, we are lost!

An old childhood friend asks for help in solving a series of unexplained events at a newly started mine high up north in the Swedish mountains. The player characters confronts a type of Vaesen they have never encountered before, and that they might have to travel to another world to contact.

The mystery centres around racism and colonialism towards the Sami, and the player characters have to choose if they should be loyal to the Swedes or solve the mystery by helping a group of Sami.


Kort efter att vi börjat med att ta oss in i berget, så började motgångarna komma slag i slag. Påbörjade gruvgångar rasade utan synlig anledning. Flera gruvarbetare drabbades av sjukdom. Utrustning gick sönder. Vi har till dags dato gjort mycket lite framsteg. Jag vet att det är mycket begärt att be dig om att ta dig till oss här i vildmarken. Men om vi inte får rätsida på situationen är vi förlorade!

En gammal barndomsvän ber Sällskapet om hjälp med att lösa oförklarliga problem vid en nystartad gruva långt upp i fjällvärlden. Rollpersonerna ställs mot en typ av väsen de inte mött förr, och som de kanske blir tvugna att resa till en annan värld för att få kontakt med.

Mysteriets centrala delar handlar om rasism och kolonialism gentemot samer, och rollpersonerna måste välja om de ska vara lojala med svenskarna eller lösa mysteriet genom att hjälpa en grupp samer.

boardgame.name: Player Two Is Unprepared
boardgame.description:
Player Two Is Unprepared is a satirical one-page RPG written in a fit of creative fury about Ernest Cline's seminal work, Ready Player One. Jump into a world of references and one-upmanship as you strive to claim your prize using the revolutionary Trivia and Toys resolution system.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: La Isla Perdida
boardgame.description:
Many stories are told about the Lost Island, but those who have gone have never returned. Fishermen and sailors speak of impossible landscapes and unique creatures. "I am completely surrounded by mountains and the rivers are going uphill!" One exclaims, "No! Actually there is a forest that crosses the island from end to end whose trees are as high as a hill ': They all have some truth in their stories ...

In this roll & write game each player must draw different types of territories on his sheet, trying to fulfill as best as possible 4 different scoring criteria different in each game. On his turn the Active player must decide what type of territory is going to be drawn that turn, roll the dice and choose a result to define the amount he wants to draw of the chosen territory. The rest of the players must choose the amount from the remaining dice and draw the type of territory chosen by the active player. As the active player you must choose carefully what to draw because you have a limited use for each type of territory.

When a player cannot draw on his map the game ends and the points are counted according to the 4 criteria selected at the beginning of the game.

boardgame.name: Sandwich Wars
boardgame.description:
Sandwich Wars is in town! It is a unique moment for all sandwich experts to demonstrate the quality and creativity of their products. In this contest, each participant must prepare all kinds of sandwiches with the most varied ingredients trying to meet the challenges imposed by the judges. The cook who makes the best sandwiches (and makes the best use of the opportunities that come their way) will be hailed as the winner and great sandwich master!

In this game, each participant must play ingredient cards to the table to complete the different culinary challenges that are in the center of the table. During the game they must manage their money, their time, their assistants and the opportunities that arise!
_________________________________________

En Sandwich Wars los jugadores deben cumplir desafíos de sándwiches, para esto deben bajar a la mesa ingredientes de su mano que correspondan con las necesidades de los desafíos que están a la vista y completarlos antes que los demás. Al completar un desafío se consiguen distintas recompensas. Cuando un jugador haya completado su quinto pedido se completa la ronda y se da por finalizado el juego. El jugador que haya obtenido más cantidad de puntos de victoria será el ganador

boardgame.name: For Sale: Metal Coins
boardgame.description:
A set of 72 classy metal coins to replace the cardboard ones:

60 x $1,000
12 x $5,000

boardgame.name: The Mysterious Jellid
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

An amphibious race of humanoid jellyfish.

boardgame.name: One Foot in the Grave
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Remove a keystone,
and the arch collapses.
It’ll be no different with her.

Like every city, Rochester has its ghosts — and like other cities, it has those who prey upon and those who aid the dead. The machinations of a young but powerful Reaper, the Iridescent Maggot, threaten one of the dead patrons of Rochester’s ghost community, and there are none who can stand against it. None, that is, save the Sin-Eaters of Rochester, who will brave even the Underworld to keep their city safe.

One Foot in the Grave contains:

A full introductory story designed to guide players and Storytellers into the world of Geist: The Sin-Eaters 2nd Edition.
Nine ready-to-play characters.
Abbreviated rules, including everything needed to play out the story.
Story hooks to extend play into a full Chronicle.

boardgame.name: Kingdom 1183
boardgame.description:
Kingdom 1183 is a smooth, yet intricate economy and warfare simulator driven by your ever-improving strategy. It is a combination of worker placement, resource gathering, economy management, and combat. Your fate in Kingdom 1183 is decided by your strategy and choices.

You will build and manage your own kingdom. There is no area to control, no shared board. Instead, you can choose from one of seven ways to win including combat-free solely economy-based victories. The game is played alone or with three friends and is expandable to eight players or more. All game modes can be played in team or free-for-all setups. Every night will be very different from the last.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Skies of Sordane: Airship Campaigns
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Sordane is a world filled with both high tech societies and unforgiving wildlands untamed by the civilized world. It is a planet with 9 continents and a diverse plethora of nations, races and cultures. Races live in mixed societies all over the planet.

Sordane is a high fantasy, arcanapunk world. It has a high technological level while simultaneously being rooted in a low-fi fantasy realm. The technology of Sordane is powered by the ever sought after sordalite crystals. These crystals power the giant airships, floating cities, shard constructs, weapons and more. The people of Sordane value sordalite above all other precious materials and goods. It drives the heartbeat of the world.

boardgame.name: Marvel United: X-Men
boardgame.description: In Marvel United: X-Men, you take the role of iconic Marvel Heroes cooperating to stop the master plan of a powerful Villain controlled by the game. Each Villain unveils their unique master plan, with cards that trigger different effects, and threats that pose challenges across the locations. Heroes must choose carefully the cards to play from their unique decks, that not only offer different actions and superpowers to use, but also combine with the actions of other Heroes to do the impossible. Build your storyline, unite your powers, save the day!

boardgame.name: Shadows Under Ice
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Like shadows under ice, a dark secret threatens this town. Townsfolk act out of the norm for themselves, and you are no less vulnerable. But you can give them the help they request and face the truth beneath the ice.

A four-hour adventure for tier 1, 2, or 3 characters.

Social Interaction and exploration, with light combat

Content warnings: helping people in mental health crisis—suicidal thoughts, isolation, claustrophobia, insomnia, depression, and hallucinations
boardgame.rpgseries: DC-PoA Dungeoncraft, Plague of Ancients Adventures

boardgame.name: 50 Encounters at a Wild West Rodeo or State Fair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

While rodeos and state fairs are great places to eat, drink, and be merry, they can also be the source of multiple adventures and surprises.

This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to your next local celebration. This list is intended for the western genre of games (like Boot Hill, Tall Tales, Deadlands, etc.). We recommend one roll per hour to add a bit of spice to the festivities. This product uses the term “PC” or “PC’s” to refer to player characters.

boardgame.name: Procession
boardgame.description:
Every year the citizens of Edmund Valley are witness to the Procession, a march of fantastic and monstrous beings that pass through the town, and as they do, they perform miracles. Discover the miracles of the Procession and decide how they change your version of Edmund Valley.

This is a one or more player game that requires a deck of cards to play.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: 100 Spaceship Quirks - Vol 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Spaceships are like special homes for a crew that can last for decades at a time. And all good captains quickly learn to alter their ship to fit their particular needs, personality and aesthetic. And over time, these choices can alter the very programming and infrastructure of any space vessel. For better or worse.

This list is intended for any space opera setting (like Traveller, Star Wars, Star Trek, Space Opera, Rifts, Babylon 5, Red Dwarf, etc.) where technology is not necessarily uniform or simple. This list can be applied to shuttles, passenger vessels, mining ships, smugglers, cargo crafts, dreadnaughts, and so on. This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to your next bucket of bolts.

boardgame.name: L'Neuvieme: A 9-Card Chase
boardgame.description:
The notorious thief L’Neuvieme has just committed their latest dastardly crime! Police tracked them to the small town of Nonaville, but the trail went cold there. As the world’s foremost private detective, you have been called in to track L’Neuvieme down and put them behind bars.

L'Neuvieme is a solitaire hidden movement and deduction game that can be played entirely in-hand. Over the course of nine turns, you will move around the quiet town of Nonaville, and receive clues as to L'Neuvieme's movement. However, some of these clues may be misleading, so you will have to use all of your deductive skills to pin down where L'Neuvieme is hiding.

At any turn, you can attempt to corner L'Neuvieme if you are confident you have found them. However, for each incorrect attempt you make, your score will decrease, and if you fail to successfully corner L'Neuvieme by the end of the ninth turn, they will evade you for good!

L'Neuvieme features 12 scenarios, and a number of optional modular variants, that add plenty of replay value to this quick game of cat-and-mouse. Do you have what it takes to send L'Neuvieme back to prison?

boardgame.name: Studies in Sorcery: Divination
boardgame.description:
Studies in Sorcery: Divination is an expansion for Studies in Sorcery that adds in the Divination project cards. The school of Divination has several major themes:

Place watchful Fate tokens to prophesy your opponent’s action and be rewarded for successful predictions.
Manipulate perception, placing extra credit tokens and turning demerits into a positive.
Increase knowledge of hidden information which you can use against your opponents.
Be rewarded for surrendering yourself to fate and pushing your luck.


—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Studies in Sorcery

boardgame.name: 100 Western Treasures Vol 4: Bearer Bonds
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the United States, bearer bonds were first introduced in the late 1800s, to fund Reconstruction during the post-Civil War era. They were instantly popular, since they are easily transferred and millions of dollars were issued using relatively few certificates, simplifying transactions. This list of 100 bearer bonds (and their attached coupons) will let you add this kind of wealth to any Western setting.

How they work: Bonds are a debt vehicle to help a company or government raise capital. Anyone with the money was able to buy a bearer bond, and unlike other bonds, their ownership was anonymous (like cash). Coupons are included so that they can be redeemed at preset interest rates on an annual basis. The bond itself can be turned in for cash at any time, but any coupons that haven’t matured are worthless. There is no legal re-course if the bearer bond or coupons is lost, stolen or destroyed (like cash). This list assumes that these were issued by the US government, but the GM can decide another company or nation authorized any bearer bond to raise capital. If the company or nation collapses, then the bonds are worthless.

boardgame.name: 100 Escape Pods Vol 1: In Space
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the deeps of space, sometimes you need to leave a battle, accident, or situation far behind. Escape pods are small vehicles used to leave spaceships, space stations, and spaceports in a time of need. Each pod is equipped with limited food, water, air, navigation, fuel, tools, and an emergency beacon to make survival possible.

This system-agnostic list can be applied to any game system with a space-faring community (like Traveler, Star Wars, Star Trek, Red Dwarf, Space Opera, Rifts, GURPS Space, etc.). This list assumes that the escape pod has been found by an outside group answering the call of the pod’s emergency beacon and that the escape pod has been stored inside a ship, station or port for years with minimal direct upkeep (leading to potential pod failures or damage due to space junk, aliens, or pirates). This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension to the distress signal in space.

boardgame.name: 100 Fantasy Forest Finds - Vol 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Forests have a feeling of power and life that's clear to anyone who enters them. And with that notion of the old primordial power comes the unknown and the hidden. Whether this is a ruin hidden away in a tiny clearing, or a source for an easy meal, the trees and bushes hide and provide refuge to hunter and hunted alike in a strange and lush environment. So why not take the utmost advantage of that situation in a fantasy game where the forest represents mystery and opportunity.

This list is intended for any fantasy setting where mysteries and secrets are plentiful and ever-present in a hostile world. This list can be applied to a small grove of trees, a common forest, a overrun wilderness, or a timberland of forts and new industry. We recommend that Game Masters apply 1 to 3 rolls on this table (if they are in a larger area, then this number can easily double). This roleplaying tool gives you dozens of different ways to add a new dimension of personality to the area being explored.

boardgame.name: Purplest Prose
boardgame.description:
Our subtitle ought to say it all: this is a game about coming together to write the trashiest romance stories you can think of! Build a group of 3-5 players to keep things quick, dirty and fun. Develop a writer persona - complete with a trashy social media profile to introduce yourself with - and engage in some Cards Against Humanity style gameplay as each one of you competes to make the best romance novel evar.

Purplest Prose just needs two six-sided dice, index cards, tokens, things you can write with, about two hours for game time, and a great sense of humor. It's crunch time, honey!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: So You Want to Write Fanfic
boardgame.description:
The Filipino fanfiction scene of the early to mid-2010s. At least, how the Internet remembers it.

You are a dedicated fanfiction writer, pouring your heart and soul into your work! The catch? You’re also a high school student who’s never even experienced being in love.

A fanfic generator as well as a supplement for Purplest Prose! Please check it out if you can.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: 100 Millionaires 6
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This 100 list features a whole bunch of millionaires for your modern era campaign. Some folks have barely broke their first million while other entries are more suited for multi-millionaires who are steadily working towards breaking into the billionaire territory. Each entry includes first and last name, gender, age, role/occupation, and a general descriptive.

Use these folks as associates to criminals, victims of criminals, annoying people the characters have to deal with, innocent bystanders, crooked influences, or anything else you may need for a modern/crime, superhero campaign, or otherwise.

boardgame.name: 50 Bikers 5
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This list contains 50 different bikers to use with a variety of campaign genres including modern/crime, cyberpunk, grim near future, retro-modern, street level super hero, post apocalypse, zombie outbreak, modern horror, etc. Each entry includes the following: First (or Nick Name) and Last Name, Age, Gender, Brief Descriptive, Color and Model of Motorcycle, and the biker’s weapon(s) of choice.

boardgame.name: 100 Sci Fi Alien Translations
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A collection of 100 different spoken expressions in a foreign sounding tongue along with their translated meaning. This is perfect for a GM that wants to have the star faring characters encounter someone (or something) speaking a dialect that is not immediately recognizable. Some things might be spoken directly to the characters while other translated expressions may just be overheard conversation.

boardgame.name: 100 Space Pirate Ship Crew Mates
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This 100 list contains a bunch of star faring scoundrels for you to add to the roster of a pirate ship’s crew. Either use this list as a whole to flesh out big ships or randomly roll to stock smaller vessels. Each entry includes: Name, descriptive and roll, carried weapon(s).

boardgame.name: 100 Alien Biome Locations 34
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need to flesh out some quick locations for that planet the characters are on but you don’t have time to think up anything? Use this list instead! This product features 100 space age locations that can be dropped on to most worlds. Included is a full name (with geographic type) as well as some notable feature or something the characters would find in the particular location.

boardgame.name: Aventuria: Alternative Geschlechterkarten
boardgame.description:
This promo pack contains the four alternate gender hero cards and their respective talents cards for the four Aventuria base game heroes. They all have different talent points from their alternate gender card. Includes:

Inaniel Flötenträumer (EK) / Inaniel Whistledreamer (ES)
Rathelia Ricottini (HS) / Rathelia Ricottini (HR)
Thallian Fuxfell (TM) / Thallian Foxfur (TM)
Hukla Tochter der Hogna (ZS) / Hukla daughter of Hogna (DB)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Aventuria: Adventure Card Game
